articles.title: Philosopher Analyst
articles.description: A blog of musing by Zoë Turner
articles.contents:
I am an NHS-R
Community Champion and have written a few blogs on R and the
Community here. I also
run some of the Community’s Introduction to R and R Studio courses and
attended every conference, even speaking at the last couple:
Why do I need
to learn R when I can use SQL? 1:05:07
I’ve also attended panels on behalf of NHS-R Community:
Insight 2020
and NHS-R: The importance of R



I am the Non-Executive Director for the Association of Professional
Healthcare Analysts, leading specifically on equality, diversity and
inclusion.
Watch me here: Data challenges in a
time of crisis
Why Philosopher Analyst?
I studied Philosophy many years ago and had no idea about analysis or
programming but I was lucky to get a chance to work with some A&E
data in one job and was hooked on data from then on. I started out using
SQL and my journey into learning R started around the same time as NHS-R
Community started.
Find me on Twitter or LinkedIn
I share my code on GitHub
and my work email is zoe.turner2@nottshc.nhs.uk

articles.title: Philosopher Analyst
articles.description: You can take the Analyst out of Philosophy, but never the Philosophy out of the Analyst
articles.contents:
Philosopher Analyst

I am a Data Scientist working in the data science team within the
clinical development unit of Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Trust where
I spend my days working with mental and general health patient level
data, as well as Public Health data. I’m also involved with the trust’s
Ethic Committee and consequently reviving my former interest medical
ethics.
